subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage driving aging, classic free radical theory.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS accumulation and oxidative damage as primary aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS-induced damage and impaired mitophagy leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced mitochondrial damage and vicious cycle accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS accumulation causing oxidative damage and aging, modulated by antioxidants.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Classic mitochondrial ROS overproduction causing oxidative damage and aging-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial ROS accumulation and oxidative damage driving reproductive aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial ROS-induced oxidative damage as central to brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mutation in complex II increases mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Nox4-mediated mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage and cardiac aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial ROS causes oxidative damage to muscle proteins leading to muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage driving cardiac aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Deficiency Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on impaired mitophagy (PINK1/Parkin pathway) causing accumulation of dysfunctional mitochondria and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Deficiency Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial-lysosomal axis dysfunction impairing mitophagy and mitochondrial quality control in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial stress signaling, adaptive responses including mitophagy and mtUPR, and failure leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS, quality control pathways (mitophagy, mtUPR), and mtDNA mutations affecting stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction, mitonuclear communication, and stem cell exhaustion in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial oxidative stress induces cellular senescence and stem cell exhaustion driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial ROS, mtDNA mutations, and apoptosis contribute to aging and reproductive senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Age-related decline in mitochondrial respiratory chain, mtDNA mutations, ROS, and apoptosis in immune cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress Signaling and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial hormesis and adaptive mitochondrial responses modulate diabetic complications and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Chaperone and Proteostasis Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mitochondrial small heat shock proteins maintain proteostasis, prevent protein aggregation, and extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Respiratory Chain Supramolecular Organisation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on supramolecular organization of respiratory chain complexes affecting ROS production and mitochondrial function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Polymorphism Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of mtDNA mutations and polymorphisms causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Calcium Overload and Dysfunction Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: TRPC3-mediated mitochondrial calcium overload causes mitochondrial dysfunction and renal aging.
